meanings.definition: Maintain in its original or existing state.
meanings.sent1: I want to preserve this old photo so it doesn't get damaged.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preserve historical buildings for future generations to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled juice on the paper I was trying to preserve.
meanings.sent4: She tried to preserve the memory of her grandmother by baking her famous cookies.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special spray to preserve her painting from fading in the sun.

meanings.definition: Keep safe from harm or injury.
meanings.sent1: Please preserve the fragile vase while moving it to the new shelf.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters worked hard to preserve the homes from the spreading wildfire.
meanings.sent3: He tried to preserve his sandwich from his hungry dog, but failed.
meanings.sent4: The mother's hug seemed to preserve her child from all the troubles in the world.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella helped preserve her from getting wet in the rain.

meanings.definition: A place where game is protected and kept for hunting.
meanings.sent1: The wildlife preserve is home to many different animals.
meanings.sent2: Visitors can explore the nature trails in the game preserve.
meanings.sent3: The game preserve was so quiet, you could hear a pin drop.
meanings.sent4: The hunters waited patiently at the edge of the game preserve.
meanings.sent5: The game preserve ranger explained the rules to the group before their hunt.
